questions.question: Infiltration of a soil can be measured by

explanations.a: Infiltration of a soil can be measured by flooding type infiltrometers
explanations.b: Infiltration of a soil can be measured by rainfall simulators
explanations.c: Infiltration of a soil can be measured by hydrograph analysis
explanations.d: Infiltration of a soil can be measured by flooding type infiltrometer, rainfall simulator, hydrograph analysis

questions.question: Single ring infiltrometer is also called as

explanations.a: Single ring infiltrometer is also called as Tube type infiltrometer
explanations.b: Single ring infiltrometer is also called as simple infiltrometer
explanations.c: Single ring infiltrometer is also called as both tube type or simple infiltrometer
explanations.d: Single ring infiltrometer is also called as both tube type or simple infiltrometer

explanations.a: The unit of  accumulated infiltration is cm
explanations.b: The rate of infiltration rate is cm/hr
explanations.c: unit of   infiltration rate is not days

questions.question: Chief disadvantage of flooding type of infiltrometer

answers.a: The raindrop impact is not considered
answers.b: Driving plate into soil disturbs soil sample
answers.c: Infiltration rate to some extent depends on size of infiltrometers

explanations.a: One of the disadvantage of flooding type of infiltrometer is,  the raindrop impact is not considered
explanations.b: One of the disadvantage of flooding type of infiltrometer is, driving plate into soil disturbs soil sample
explanations.c: One of the disadvantage of flooding type of infiltrometer is,infiltration rate to some extent depends on size of infiltrometers
explanations.d: All the options are major disadvantages of infiltrometer.

questions.question: The infiltration capacity of soil decreases ________ as the time elapses.

explanations.a: The infiltration capacity of soil does not decrease linearly as the time elapses.
explanations.b: The infiltration capacity of soil does not decrease elliptically as the time elapses.
explanations.c: The infiltration capacity of soil  decreases exponentially as the time elapses.
explanations.d: The infiltration capacity of soil does not decrease vertically as the time elapses
